title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Proverbs chapter 22 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Proverbs Chapter 22.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 22:1, what is better to choose than great riches?
questions.correctAnswer: A good name
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:1 states that a good name is rather to be chosen than great riches.

questions.question: Who is the maker of both the rich and the poor, according to Proverbs 22:2?
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:2 declares that the LORD is the maker of both the rich and the poor.

questions.question: What does a prudent man do according to Proverbs 22:3?
options: Foresees the evil and hides himself
questions.correctAnswer: Foresees the evil and hides himself
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:3 explains that a prudent man foresees the evil and hides himself.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 22:6, what will happen if you train up a child in the way he should go?
options: He will not depart from it when he is old
questions.correctAnswer: He will not depart from it when he is old
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:6 says that training up a child in the right way will keep him from departing from it in old age.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 22:7 say about the borrower?
options: The borrower is servant to the lender
questions.correctAnswer: The borrower is servant to the lender
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:7 states that the borrower is servant to the lender.

questions.question: What shall he that hath a bountiful eye receive, according to Proverbs 22:9?
questions.correctAnswer: He shall be blessed
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:9 teaches that he who has a bountiful eye shall be blessed.

questions.question: What will happen if you cast out the scorner, according to Proverbs 22:10?
options: Contention, strife, and reproach will cease
questions.correctAnswer: Contention, strife, and reproach will cease
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:10 says casting out the scorner will cause contention, strife, and reproach to cease.

questions.question: What does the mouth of strange women compare to in Proverbs 22:14?
questions.correctAnswer: A deep pit
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:14 describes the mouth of strange women as a deep pit.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 22:15, what is bound in the heart of a child?
questions.correctAnswer: Foolishness
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:15 states that foolishness is bound in the heart of a child.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 22:22 warn against doing to the poor?
questions.correctAnswer: Robbing and oppressing them
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:22 instructs not to rob the poor or oppress the afflicted.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 22:4 says that humility and the fear of the LORD bring riches, honor, and life.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:4 clearly states that by humility and the fear of the LORD come riches, honor, and life.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 22:24 advises making friendship with an angry man.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:24 advises against making friendship with an angry man.

questions.question: True or False: According to Proverbs 22:29, a diligent man shall stand before kings.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:29 states that a diligent man shall stand before kings.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Proverbs 22:6: 'Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: depart from it
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:6 says that when trained rightly, a child will not depart from that way when old.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Proverbs 22:1: 'A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: silver and gold
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:1 compares a good name and loving favour as better than silver and gold.

medium.title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Proverbs Chapter 22 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 22:6 teach us about the importance of parenting and spiritual training?
options: Train up a child in the way he should go, and he will not depart from it when old
Allow children freedom to choose their own path
Teach children only through example, not words
questions.correctAnswer: Train up a child in the way he should go, and he will not depart from it when old
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:6 emphasizes the lifelong impact of early spiritual and moral training, teaching that consistent guidance helps a child maintain godly ways into adulthood. This aligns with the biblical principles of parenting found in Ephesians 6:4 and Deuteronomy 6:6-7.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 22:1 suggest is more valuable than great riches?
options: A good name and loving favour
questions.correctAnswer: A good name and loving favour
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:1 teaches that a good reputation and loving favour are more desirable than material wealth like silver and gold, highlighting the value of character and relationships over riches. This reflects the biblical emphasis on integrity (Proverbs 22:1, Ecclesiastes 7:1).

questions.question: According to Proverbs 22:4, what are the benefits of humility and fearing the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Riches, honour, and life
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:4 links humility and reverence for God with blessings such as riches, honour, and life, showing that true prosperity comes from a godly attitude. This complements teachings in Proverbs 3:34 and Psalm 25:9 about humility and God's favor.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with fear and anxiety about future troubles. Based on Proverbs 22:3, what biblical truth would you share?
options: The prudent foresee evil and hide themselves, but the simple go on and suffer
Fear is a sign of weak faith
Ignore troubles and they will pass
Trust only in your own strength
questions.correctAnswer: The prudent foresee evil and hide themselves, but the simple go on and suffer
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:3 teaches the wisdom of foresight and prudence in avoiding harm. Encouraging vigilance and wise preparation aligns with biblical counsel to trust God while acting responsibly (Ecclesiastes 7:12, Matthew 10:16).

questions.question: What warning does Proverbs 22:7 give about debt and financial relationships?
options: The borrower is servant to the lender
Debt is a way to gain wealth
Debt is unimportant if you can repay later
questions.correctAnswer: The borrower is servant to the lender
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:7 warns that borrowing creates a form of servitude, emphasizing prudent financial stewardship and avoiding unnecessary debt. This teaching aligns with biblical principles on wise money management (Romans 13:8, Proverbs 6:1-5).

questions.question: Which action does Proverbs 22:9 commend as a way to receive blessings?
options: Giving bread to the poor with a bountiful eye
questions.correctAnswer: Giving bread to the poor with a bountiful eye
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:9 teaches that generosity toward the needy brings blessings, encouraging believers to practice stewardship and compassion as part of their faith (Luke 6:38, 2 Corinthians 9:6-7).

questions.question: What is the result of casting out a scorner according to Proverbs 22:10?
options: Contention, strife, and reproach shall cease
Peace will be harder to maintain
questions.correctAnswer: Contention, strife, and reproach shall cease
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:10 shows that removing a scorner (one who mocks or causes strife) leads to peace and reduces conflict, underscoring the value of godly fellowship and correction (Proverbs 15:1, Titus 3:10).

questions.question: According to Proverbs 22:15, what is the remedy for foolishness bound in the heart of a child?
options: Leaving the child to learn from mistakes
questions.correctAnswer: The rod of correction
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:15 teaches that discipline (symbolized by the rod) is necessary to remove foolishness from a child's heart, highlighting the importance of correction in spiritual and moral growth (Proverbs 13:24, Hebrews 12:7-11).

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 22:22 teaches that it is acceptable to rob the poor because they are poor.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:22 explicitly commands not to rob or oppress the poor, emphasizing justice and compassion, and warning that the LORD will defend the afflicted (Proverbs 22:22-23; Exodus 22:21-24).

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 22:29 states that a diligent man will stand before kings and not mean men.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:29 highlights the value of diligence and excellence in work, teaching that such a person will gain honor and recognition from leaders, reflecting God's blessing on faithful service (Colossians 3:23-24).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Proverbs 22:24 warns, "Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go: Lest thou learn his ways, and get a ______ to thy soul."
questions.correctAnswer: snare
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:24-25 warns against close association with angry or furious people, as their behavior can trap or harm your soul. The correct word is 'snare', indicating a trap or danger.

questions.question: Based on Proverbs 22:12, how does the LORD help preserve knowledge and deal with the words of transgressors?
options: The eyes of the LORD preserve knowledge and overthrow the words of the transgressor
The LORD ignores the words of the transgressor
The LORD encourages transgressors to speak
The LORD only preserves knowledge in the wise
questions.correctAnswer: The eyes of the LORD preserve knowledge and overthrow the words of the transgressor
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:12 teaches that God's watchful eyes guard true knowledge and thwart the deceitful words of sinners, showing divine protection over wisdom and truth (Psalm 34:15, Proverbs 15:3).

questions.question: How does Proverbs 22:16 warn about the consequences of oppressing the poor or giving to the rich to gain wealth?
options: They shall surely come to want
They will receive honor among men
questions.correctAnswer: They shall surely come to want
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:16 teaches that exploiting the poor or currying favor with the rich for selfish gain ultimately leads to lack, warning against dishonest gain and encouraging righteousness (Proverbs 28:27, James 5:1-6).

questions.question: According to Proverbs 22:17-21, what is the benefit of heeding the words of the wise and keeping them within you?
options: They will be fitted in thy lips and increase trust in the LORD
You will gain wealth and power
You will be popular among men
questions.correctAnswer: They will be fitted in thy lips and increase trust in the LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:17-21 encourages listening to wisdom and internalizing it, which shapes speech and strengthens trust in God, underpinning practical godliness and confident faith (Psalm 119:11, Proverbs 3:5-6).

questions.question: What does Proverbs 22:28 teach about respecting boundaries and heritage?
options: Remove not the ancient landmark which thy fathers have set
Change boundaries as you see fit
Ignore the landmarks of the past
Set new boundaries for your own gain
questions.correctAnswer: Remove not the ancient landmark which thy fathers have set
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:28 commands respect for established boundaries and traditions, symbolizing integrity and respect for heritage, which prevents injustice and conflict (Deuteronomy 19:14, Proverbs 23:10).

hard.title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Proverbs Chapter 22.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 22:1 prioritize as more valuable than great riches and silver and gold?
options: A good name and loving favour
questions.correctAnswer: A good name and loving favour
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:1 states that a good name is to be chosen rather than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold, emphasizing reputation and favor over material wealth.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 22:2, what is the theological reason that rich and poor meet together?
options: The LORD is the maker of them all
They are bound by trade agreements
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD is the maker of them all
questions.explanation: The verse emphasizes divine sovereignty by stating the LORD created both rich and poor equally, highlighting equality under God.

questions.question: In the context of Proverbs 22:3, what is the key difference between the prudent man and the simple?
options: The prudent foresees evil and hides, the simple pass on and are punished
The prudent is wealthy, the simple is poor
The prudent is young, the simple is old
The prudent speaks much, the simple is silent
questions.correctAnswer: The prudent foresees evil and hides, the simple pass on and are punished
questions.explanation: This verse contrasts prudence and naivety, showing the wise avoid danger while the simple ignore it and suffer consequences.

questions.question: Proverbs 22:4 links humility and the fear of the LORD with what resulting blessings?
questions.correctAnswer: Riches, honour, and life
questions.explanation: The verse explicitly states that humility and fearing the LORD bring riches, honour, and life, reflecting a traditional wisdom theme connecting character and blessing.

questions.question: What is the warning given in Proverbs 22:5 about the path of the 'froward'?
options: Thorns and snares are in their way
They will find gold and silver
They will be honored by kings
questions.correctAnswer: Thorns and snares are in their way
questions.explanation: The verse uses metaphorical language—thorns and snares—to describe obstacles and dangers awaiting the perverse or stubborn person.

questions.question: What promise does Proverbs 22:6 offer regarding the training of a child?
options: When he is old, he will not depart from it
He will be wise beyond his years
questions.correctAnswer: When he is old, he will not depart from it
questions.explanation: This verse asserts the lasting impact of early instruction, emphasizing the formative nature of childhood education.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 22:7, what is the relationship between the rich and the poor, especially in terms of borrowing?
options: The rich rule over the poor; the borrower is servant to the lender
The poor are honored by the rich
The borrower is free from the lender
The rich and poor share equally
questions.correctAnswer: The rich rule over the poor; the borrower is servant to the lender
questions.explanation: This verse highlights social and economic realities of the ancient Near East, illustrating power dynamics tied to wealth and debt.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Proverbs 22:9 teaches that he that hath a ______ eye shall be blessed.
questions.correctAnswer: bountiful
questions.explanation: The phrase 'bountiful eye' refers to generosity, and the verse links this trait with receiving blessings.

questions.question: What consequence does Proverbs 22:8 associate with sowing iniquity?
options: Reaping vanity and the rod of anger failing
questions.correctAnswer: Reaping vanity and the rod of anger failing
questions.explanation: The verse uses agricultural metaphor to explain that sinful actions lead to futile outcomes and loss of discipline.

questions.question: Proverbs 22:10 advises removing which type of person to end strife and contention?
questions.correctAnswer: The scorner
questions.explanation: Scorners cause conflict and reproach, so removing them leads to peace, a principle consistent with biblical wisdom literature.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 22:11, what is the benefit of loving pureness of heart?
options: The king shall be his friend for the grace of his lips
He will gain wealth and honor
He will live a long and peaceful life
questions.correctAnswer: The king shall be his friend for the grace of his lips
questions.explanation: This verse highlights the social advantage of integrity and gracious speech, showing favor from rulers.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 22:13 depicts the slothful man as exaggerating dangers outside, such as a lion in the streets.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The verse describes the slothful man who makes excuses by fearing imaginary dangers, illustrating laziness and fearfulness.

questions.question: What is the metaphor used in Proverbs 22:14 for the mouth of strange women, and what is the consequence?
options: A deep pit; he that is abhorred of the LORD shall fall therein
A flowing river; he that drinks will be refreshed
A burning fire; he that touches will be burned
A shining light; he that follows will find joy
questions.correctAnswer: A deep pit; he that is abhorred of the LORD shall fall therein
questions.explanation: The verse warns of the danger of seduction and evil companionship using the deep pit metaphor, indicating ruin for the wicked.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 22:15, what role does 'the rod of correction' play in a child's life?
options: It drives foolishness far from him
questions.correctAnswer: It drives foolishness far from him
questions.explanation: The verse emphasizes discipline as necessary to remove folly from a child’s heart, reflecting ancient Near Eastern educational practices.

questions.question: What social injustice is condemned in Proverbs 22:22-23, and what is God's promised response?
options: Robbing the poor and oppressing the afflicted; the LORD will plead their cause and spoil those who spoiled them
Ignoring the widows and orphans; the LORD will send famine
Lying in court; the LORD will blind their eyes
Failing to tithe; the LORD will curse their fields
questions.correctAnswer: Robbing the poor and oppressing the afflicted; the LORD will plead their cause and spoil those who spoiled them
questions.explanation: These verses affirm God's justice, promising divine vindication for the oppressed and judgment on oppressors.

theological.title: Proverbs Chapter 22 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Proverbs Chapter 22 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 22, what is to be chosen rather than great riches?
questions.correctAnswer: A good name
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:1 states that a good name is rather to be chosen than great riches. This emphasizes the value of character and reputation over material wealth. Similarly, Proverbs 3:9 values honoring God above riches, and 1 Timothy 6:6 teaches that godliness with contentment is great gain.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 22 say about the origin of both the rich and the poor?
options: The LORD is the maker of them all
Riches come by hard work only
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD is the maker of them all
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:2 declares that both the rich and the poor meet together because the LORD is their creator. This teaches God's sovereignty over all humanity, reflecting Genesis 1:27 where all are made in God's image, and Acts 17:26 which declares God made all nations of one blood.

questions.question: How does a prudent person respond to evil according to Proverbs 22?
options: Foresees the evil and hides himself
questions.correctAnswer: Foresees the evil and hides himself
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:3 explains that a prudent man foresees evil and hides himself, while the simple are punished by passing on. This reflects biblical wisdom on discernment and avoiding sin (James 1:5, Ephesians 5:15-16).

questions.question: According to Proverbs 22, what are the blessings that come by humility and the fear of the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Riches, honor, and life
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:4 teaches that humility and the fear of the LORD bring riches, honor, and life. This aligns with Proverbs 3:34, James 4:6 on God giving grace to the humble, and Psalm 112:1-3 on the blessings of the righteous.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 22:6 promise about training up a child in the way he should go?
options: When he is old, he will not depart from it
He will become wealthy and honored
He will avoid all troubles and sins
He will be wise beyond his years
questions.correctAnswer: When he is old, he will not depart from it
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:6 promises that training a child in the right way leads to lifelong adherence. This reflects biblical teaching on instruction (Ephesians 6:4, Deuteronomy 6:7) and the perseverance of godly training (2 Timothy 3:15).

questions.question: What is the relationship between the rich and the poor described in Proverbs 22:7?
options: The rich rules over the poor
The poor lend to the rich
questions.correctAnswer: The rich rules over the poor
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:7 states the rich rule over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender, illustrating the power dynamics due to wealth. This agrees with teachings on wealth and servitude (Ecclesiastes 5:13, Luke 16:13).

questions.question: What consequence does Proverbs 22:8 warn about sowing iniquity?
questions.correctAnswer: He shall reap vanity
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:8 warns that sowing iniquity leads to reaping vanity, meaning futile or worthless outcomes. This principle echoes Galatians 6:7 and Hosea 8:7 regarding sowing and reaping sin's consequences.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 22:9 say about a person with a bountiful eye?
questions.correctAnswer: He shall be blessed
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:9 states that one who is generous ('bountiful eye') is blessed because he gives to the poor. This matches New Testament teachings on generosity (2 Corinthians 9:6-7, Luke 6:38).

questions.question: According to Proverbs 22:10, what happens when the scorner is cast out?
questions.correctAnswer: Contention and strife cease
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:10 teaches that removing the scorner stops contention and reproach. This aligns with biblical wisdom about the dangers of fools and quarrels (Proverbs 20:3, Romans 16:17).

questions.question: What does Proverbs 22:11 say about a person who loves pureness of heart?
options: The king shall be his friend
questions.correctAnswer: The king shall be his friend
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:11 states that those who love purity of heart and gracious speech will find favor with the king. This reflects biblical principles of integrity and favor (Psalm 101:6, Proverbs 16:13).

questions.question: Who preserves knowledge and overthrows the words of the transgressor according to Proverbs 22:12?
questions.correctAnswer: The eyes of the LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:12 declares that the LORD’s eyes preserve knowledge and thwart the wicked's words, showing God's omniscient justice. This corresponds with Psalm 33:13-15 and Hebrews 4:13.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 22:15 say about foolishness in a child’s heart?
options: It is bound in the heart but correction drives it away
It is absent and must be taught
questions.correctAnswer: It is bound in the heart but correction drives it away
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:15 teaches that foolishness is innate in children but discipline removes it. This aligns with biblical emphasis on discipline for growth (Hebrews 12:7-11, Ephesians 6:4).

questions.question: What warning does Proverbs 22:22 give about oppressing the poor?
options: Do not rob or oppress the poor
It is acceptable in times of need
questions.correctAnswer: Do not rob or oppress the poor
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:22 commands not to rob or oppress the poor because God will defend them. This is consistent with Exodus 22:21-24 and James 5:4 on God's justice for the oppressed.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 22:24 advise concerning friendship with an angry man?
options: Make no friendship with an angry man
questions.correctAnswer: Make no friendship with an angry man
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:24 warns against friendship with the angry to avoid learning harmful ways. This aligns with 1 Corinthians 15:33 and Proverbs 13:20 about the influence of companions.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 22:29 say about a man diligent in his business?
questions.correctAnswer: He shall stand before kings
questions.explanation: Proverbs 22:29 promises that diligence leads to recognition before great men. This reflects biblical principles of faithful stewardship and promotion (Colossians 3:23-24, Ecclesiastes 9:10).
